posts.post_content:
Posted By: Gilbert Maines
You ain't got one so nasty that I don't want it. Try me.
Your price could be too high, but I want it.

Posted By: MikeW
Gil,
  e-mail sent.

Posted By: Gilbert Maines
Be careful when you state "You ain't got a card so nasty ..."

There are cards soo nasty  ...

And I thought I was immune, having played a bit with the guys from OBC, who have a reputation for tolerance of cosmetic considerations. But my heart is beginning to beat on its own again; but I actually have only viewed a scan of the card. The face to partial face is still a week or so away.

Thank you, Mike. You rescuing this card from its previous destiny has made my timely completion of this mini-set possible.

Posted By: Judge Dred (Fred)
My turn - I too, would like to obtain an N300 of Delahanty.  Condition need not be mint, nor VG, nor VG-, nor Good...  I'd be happy with Fair, possibly poor...  My eye may be a little more discerning than Gils but I'd like to see if there is something out there in lower grade that I could obtain.

Posted By: Jim Manos
Please sen a scan and price Thx, Jim

Posted By: MikeW
LOL Gil,
  Yes, you asked for it.. so you got it. [IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/images/happy.gif[/IMG]  I'm glad that this Big Ed has a suitable home though.  Afterall, it is still a Big Ed.

Posted By: Zach Rice
Very glad you and Mike were able to work out a deal on the Delehanty, Gil. How often can a board member ask for a Delehanty and then have one in less than 24 hours ?

Posted By: Judge Dred (Fred)
It doesn't happen often and I can only hope that lightning strikes twice!

Posted By: MikeW
Fred,
  I wish I could help you out but I think it is very unlikely that I would be willing to part with my remaining Delahanty.  Unless you had an offer that would make me lose sleep, for passing on.

Posted By: Judge Dred (Fred)
Mike,

Could you please send me a scan of your remaining Delahanty?  

Thanks,

Fred

Posted By: MikeW
Fred,
  I have a scan of it on my site if you click on the "Sports Card Collection" link at the bottom and then "19th Century HOFers".

[url]http://www.mikewolfgallery.com[/url]
